{{italic title}} {{For|a full list of Gladiators events around the world|Category:Gladiators (franchise)}} {{Unreferenced|date=September 2017}} '''''Gladiators''''' is a [[sports entertainment]] television show that was an international success during the 1990s and early 2000s with versions of the show being filmed for local broadcasters in the [[United States]], the [[United Kingdom]], [[Finland]], [[Japan]], [[Australia]], [[South Africa]], [[Sweden]], [[Nigeria]], and [[Denmark]]. However, [[Russia]], [[Germany]], and [[the Bahamas]] would also compete in international shows during the series, despite the fact that they did not have their own domestic series.
After a lengthy break, ''Gladiators'' was revived in 2008 in the UK, the US and [[Australia]]; in 2009 [[Lebanon]] created their own series featuring competitors from all over the [[Arab]] region and most recently [[Sweden]] has brought back their version which is proving most successful of all revivals, with a new revival in [[Finland]] is set for broadcast in 2017.
The concept of the show is that athletic members of the public battle against the show's own Gladiators (often semi-professional or ex-athletes) to claim points in several [[Gladiators events|events]] that require speed, strength and skill. In the final event of the show, "The Eliminator" the contenders race against each other (with starting times based on previous events), with the first to finish winning the episode and moving onto the next round.
A children's derivative of the concept was also made in the US, called ''[[Gladiators 2000]]'' (1994–1996). A UK variant of this was aired starting in 1995, called ''[[Gladiators: Train 2 Win]]''.
==History==
===1990s success=== The initial concept for the show by Dan Carr and John C. Ferraro was held in [[Erie, Pennsylvania|Erie]], [[Pennsylvania]], in the [[United States|USA]] before being sold to Samuel Goldwyn Productions/MGM where the format was adapted and televised as ''[[American Gladiators]]'' with the first series airing over 1989–90. As the show progressed, new events were introduced along with new Gladiators, sometimes retiring previous Gladiators.
Following the success of ''American Gladiators'', other countries began to produce their own versions of the show with the [[UK]] and [[Finland]] starting production in 1992. ''American Gladiators'' had already picked up a cult following in the UK after being shown on late night TV. The [[Gladiators (UK TV series)|UK]], most noticeably adapted the concept into a large arena (the [[National Indoor Arena]] in [[Birmingham]]), glamorising the show, often adapting events from the American series as well as introducing many of their own, often more high-tech. Winners from the UK and Finnish series would then go over to America, to film a special show of ''American Gladiators'' in which they competed against the current American champions along with selected athletes from other territories such as [[Japan]] and the [[Bahamas]] and [[South Korea]].
In early 1995, the first full scale international competition was launched in which selected Gladiators from the American, Finnish and British series competed against contender champions from those three countries. A fourth country, Russia was added but as they did not have their own domestic series, the Gladiators and contenders were hand-picked by Russian TV producers. The Finnish series ceased production after [[International Gladiators 1]].
In 1995, [[Gladiators (Australian TV series)|Australia]] began production of their own show, basing it on the UK series. After the first series, a three part 'Ashes' mini series was filmed in Australia, in which a selection of British and Australian Gladiators faced champions from the opposing countries. Australia then went on to compete in [[International Gladiators 2]] along with the UK and America. Russia also returned, even though they still did not have a domestic series. [[Germany]] and [[South Africa]] also competed even though they too did not have their own domestic series.
===Decline=== After [[International Gladiators 2]], the ''American Gladiators'' series ceased production due to falling ratings, although a live dinner show ran in Florida between 1996 and 1998. The UK and Australia continued to produce their own editions of the show, with the UK continuing to add new events to its roster (retiring some due to safety reasons) with Australia adding events from the UK series in its second and third series.
In 1996, the UK and Australia faced each other again in 'the Ashes 2' this time held in the UK Gladiator arena and an Australia vs. Russia mini series was filmed in Australia with two of the Russian Gladiators who had appeared in International Gladiators 2 appearing alongside new faces. After both of the mini series were filmed and aired, the Australian show was cancelled due to falling ratings, even though plans for a fourth series had commenced, which would include a brand new event that would be exclusive to Australia.
In 1997, South Africa competed against the UK in the Springbok Challenge held in the UK Gladiator arena, despite the fact that they did not have their own domestic series. Only one of the South African Gladiators who appeared in International Gladiators 2 appeared.
In 1999, it was announced that due to falling ratings, the UK series was to be axed. A final mini series in which past champions competed was filmed. It was at this time that South Africa finally began production of [[MTN Gladiators|their own series]] and in 2000, a team of UK Gladiators and contenders went over to film the Springbok Challenge 2, a series filmed exclusively for South African TV only.
===New millennium=== With the South African production in full swing, other territories began producing their own versions. [[Sweden]] began producing their own version in 2000 under the name "''Gladiatorerna''", with the old UK apparatus being shipped over. Short lived series in [[Nigeria]] (2002) and [[Denmark]] (2003) followed.
In 2001, the South African series was overhauled, but it proved unpopular with viewers and the show was axed. Sweden continued to produce ''Gladiators'', creating an event unique to the series, Spidercage, before being axed in 2004.
===The revival=== In August 2007, [[NBC]] confirmed that a revival of ''American Gladiators'' would be produced by [[Reveille Productions]] and [[MGM Television]] to air mid season during early 2008. In addition to events from the original show, the series drew elements from the 1990s UK series as well as being updated for the new millennium in which several events would be played over water. The UK also produced a revival of ''Gladiators''. In September 2007, the [[Seven Network]] in Australia announced that it too was reviving ''Gladiators'', although unlike the American revival, the Australian revival was to follow the lines of its predecessor rather than be overhauled.
The first episode of the new ''[[American Gladiators (2008 TV series)|American Gladiators]]'' premiered on Sunday 6 January 2008 proving to be a ratings hit. A seconds season was instantly commissioned. At the same time, it was announced that [[Sky One]] were commissioning a [[Gladiators (revival UK TV series)|UK revival]] which would follow the basis set by the American revival.
The [[Gladiators (2008 Australian TV series)|Australian revival]] premiered on 30 March 2008 with the UK series starting on Sunday 11 May. Both revivals proved instant ratings hits for their respective channels. On 12 May 2008, the second season of the American show began, with the series being moved to a bigger arena.
Due to low ratings, the Seven Network placed filming for a second series on hold and released the Gladiators from their holding contracts. NBC similarly have yet to commission a third series due to ratings for the second series being lower than expected.
The [[Gladiators (revival UK TV series)|UK revival]] first aired in August 2008, a second series aired in January 2009. On 20 May 2009, the UK series was axed by the new controller for Sky 1, Stuart Murphy.
The Arab World launched its own version in 2009 featuring Contenders and Gladiators from all over the Arab region. It only lasted one season.
In 2012, the Swedish Gladiators, known as "Gladiatorerna", made a return to television and the revived show has proved very successful with 3 seasons so far filmed and screened, making it the most successful and longest lasting revival of the franchise. In July 2014, it was announced a 4th season would be made. This is due to be screened in early 2015.
In July 2014, Arthur A. Smith company announced plans to bring American Gladiators back again for the third time and were shopping the idea to networks to give it a home.
In August 2018, Actor [[Seth Rogen]] and Evan Goldberg announced plans to bring American Gladiators back again for the fourth time and are shopping the idea to distributors who are interested in the revival.
==Other Ventures== ===Broadband Website=== On January 28, 2008 a broadband website will pay homage to the original series called ''americangladiators.com'' where it features clip of the original which all have been re-digitalized as clips would reintroduce original Gladiators and give fans an update on where they are today. Future segments would also include "Best Hits" and stunts that were performed on the show.
===Tour=== In 2008, MGM, Reveille and Flor-Jon Films Inc. revealed a special ''American Gladiators'' U.S. cross-country tour.
===Cartoon=== MGM along with Johnny Ferraro have put into development a cartoon series based on the show but has never aired.
===Movie=== In 2009, Johnny Ferraro wanted to bring a live-action movie of ''American Gladiators''. Former Legendary Pictures chief marketing officer Scott Mednick was producing the film where the goal was to create an action story that takes place inside the world Ferraro created.
==Format== In a standard Gladiators show, two female and two male contenders face each other and the Gladiators in anywhere from four to seven events. The line up of events differs across each show with different Gladiators playing the different events dependent on their skill type. Towards the end of the initial UK and American series, the male and female contenders did not necessarily play the same events. Contenders score points for winning against the Gladiators, with the winner having a time advantage in the last event the contenders compete in, the Eliminator.
The winner of the Eliminator goes through to the next round (or wins the series) unless a qualifying time is needed for the next round.
Shows are usually presented by a male and female host (with the exception of all but two seasons of the original American Gladiators, which were presented by two male hosts), as well as a main [[referee]] (often wearing a striped black and white shirt, in the style of an American football referee) presiding over events, handing out disqualifications or red and yellow cards to contenders or Gladiators if needed. A [[timekeeper]] is often present behind the referee but these are not always referred to or provide a speaking role. An unseen commentator will provide play by play accounts (again with the exception of the original American Gladiators series, where the on-screen hosts also provided the play by play)
The show is filmed in front of a live studio audience made up of fans and supporters of the contenders. It is not uncommon for the cameras to focus on particular crowd members or banners. Some incarnations of the show such as the Australian and original UK series have [[cheerleaders]] to provide background entertainment.
==Events== There have been 35 events involving Gladiators (as well as the Eliminator) across the incarnations. Four of the events have an alternate name in certain territories. A different selection of the events will be played in each episode. No single territory has had all thirty five events on its roster. The UK had the biggest number of events during its initial run with twenty three events.
All events were created by either the American or UK series with the exception of "Soccer Shootout" (South Africa) and "Spidercage" (Sweden). The UK notably adapted some of the American events, with the adaptations becoming the standard design for the concept. For example, the UK version of "Skytrack" would later be adopted by the Australian and American revival series whereas the UK concept of the American event "Tug-o-War" known as "Tilt" eventually superseded Tug-o-War for the 2008 American revival.
Over the course of the original UK and American series, several events were dropped, often due to safety reasons. The Eliminator was the only event which was played in every episode across every territory.
==The Gladiators== There have been more than 300 Gladiators across all participating territories. Inevitably, there has been some repeat usage of names, and there have been seven instances where the same name has been used twice in a territory for a televised series. The original American Gladiators had two different Gladiators named Lace, and the names Siren and Titan have been used in both the original and revival formats of the American show. The names Amazon, Panther, Siren and Warrior have been used for both the original and revived UK shows. The name Valkyria was used both in the original and revived series in Sweden. The names Panther, Ice, Scorpio, Lightning, Blade, Cyclone, Fierce/Hurja, Flash, Force, Shadow, Thunder, Viper, Nitro, Terminator, Cobra, Rebel, Hurricane, Laser, Phoenix, Destroyer, Rocket, Dynamite (as Miss Dynamite), Bullit as (Bullet) and Delta have been used for both male and female Gladiators.
Most Gladiators come from either a bodybuilding or athletic background. Seven Olympic athletes have competed as Gladiators: Amazon ([[Sharron Davies]]) (UK), Nightshade ([[Judy Simpson]]) (UK), Rebel ([[Jennifer Stoute]]) (UK), Olympia ([[Tatiana Grigorieva]]) (AUS Revival), Hurricane ([[Breaux Greer]]) (US Revival), Predator ([[Du'aine Ladejo]]) (UK Revival) and Battleaxe ([[Shirley Webb]]) (UK Revival).
There have been a few instances where contenders have become Gladiators. Minna Ryynänen, a quarter-finalist from the first series of Finnish Gladiators, returned as Gladiator Safiiri for the next series. UK season 3 and International Gladiators 1 champion Eunice Huthart became Gladiator Blaze. However, Eunice only competed as Blaze in non televised live shows, opting to perform as herself in future televised episodes. Australian series 2 champion and International Gladiators 2 runner up Lourene Bevaart became Glacier, American Gladiators 2008 series 1 champions Monica Carlson and Evan Dollard becoming Jet and Rocket respectively (this was actually mentioned as part of the "prize package" for this season) and after a seven-year gap, Gladiatorerna season 5 winner Patrick Lessa joined the Swedish team for the 2012 revival as Gladiator Baron Samedi.
Only two Gladiators have played for two different domestic series in differing countries; Vulcan ([[John Seru]]) who was originally an Australian Gladiator who transferred to the UK team for Season 7 upon the end of the Australian series and Fox (Tammy Baker) who transferred from the UK to the South African team when the UK series finished. Laser (Tina Andrew), a UK Gladiator went on to compete as Sheena, a member of a South African team for the Springbok Challenge 1. However, she did not compete in the domestic South African series.
Some Gladiators have died since their Gladiator careers ended, including Siren and Hawk from the original American Gladiators, Dynamite and Spartak from Russia, Zeke and Indra from Sweden, Sahara from South Africa, Ninja from Japan and Viking from Finland.

* {{flagicon|FRA}} ''Gladiateur'' (Gladiator) – Cancelled in production (1993) * {{flagicon|ESP}} ''Gladiadors'' (Gladiadors) – Cancelled in production (1994) * {{flagicon|ITA}} ''Gladiatore'' – Cancelled in production (2008) * {{flagicon|POL}} ''Gladiatorzy'' (Gladius) – Cancelled in pre-production (1999) * {{flagicon|TUR}} ''Gladyiators'' – Cancelled in production (2008)
Zodiac TV, who worked alongside TV4 and MTV Produktion to produce ''Gladiatorerna'' and ''Gladiatorerne'', also started to create series in Russia, Germany and Benelux (Netherlands, Belgium and Luxembourg) but they never materialised.
===International series and specials=== * International Challenge of Champions 1 - 1993 - 1 off episode, filmed in USA. * International Challenge of Champions 2 - 1994 - 1 off episode, filmed in USA. * [[International Gladiators 1]] - (UK, USA, Russia & Finland) - 1994 - 7 episode series, filmed in UK. * [[International Gladiators 2]] - (UK, USA, Russia, Australia, Germany & South Africa) - 1995 - 7 episode series, filmed in UK. * International Gladiators 3 - Cancelled in pre-production. - 1996 - The UK had held the previous 2 international series at considerable cost to broadcaster ITV and production company [[London Weekend Television|LWT]], who both refused to finance another series. The show was due to be filmed in Australia but with the end of the Australian domestic series, this series was cancelled as no other country agreed to host it. : This series would have featured Gladiators and contenders from Australia, United Kingdom, United States, Germany and Russia. Also interested in competing were [[New Zealand]], [[South Korea]], Japan, South Africa and a joint Scandinavian team consisting of Sweden, Finland and [[Norway]]. * [[Gladiators: Battle of the Champions]] - 1995 - 1 off episode, filmed in UK. * [[Gladiators: The Ashes 1]] - (UK vs Australia) - 1995 - 3 episode series, filmed in Australia. * [[Gladiators: The Ashes 2]] - (UK vs Australia) - 1996 - 3 episode series, filmed in UK. * Australia vs Russia - 1996 - 3 episode series, filmed in Australia. * Gladiators: The Ashes 3 - (UK vs Australia) - 1997 - Cancelled in pre-production due to the end of the Australian domestic series. *[[Gladiators: Springbok Challenge 1]] (South Africa vs UK) - 1997 - 3 episode series, filmed in UK. *[[Gladiators: Springbok Challenge 2]] (South Africa vs UK) - 2000 - 11 episode series, filmed in South Africa. This series has never been broadcast in the UK.

''Hot Wheels: AcceleRacers – The Ultimate Race'' | games = | vgs = | soundtracks = | toys = | footnotes = }} '''''Hot Wheels: AcceleRacers''''' is an [[animated series]] of four films by [[Mattel]]. It is [[computer animation|computer-animated]], produced by [[Rainmaker Studios|Mainframe Entertainment]] out of [[Vancouver]], [[British Columbia]], Canada, which also produced ''[[ReBoot]]'' and distributed by [[Warner Bros.]] Available on [[DVD]] and [[VHS]], it has also been shown on [[Cartoon Network]]. The series takes Mattel's [[Hot Wheels]] toy cars and puts them in a ''ReBoot''-like situation, with [[racing]] somewhat reminiscent of ''[[Tron]]''. This is a sequel to the 2003 animated film ''[[Hot Wheels: World Race]]'' and takes place in [[California]]. A soundtrack was distributed by [[Sony BMG]], and toys were sold in stores and given away in a [[McDonald's]] [[Happy Meal]]. A collectible card game and other merchandise were also made. ==Films== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Occupation ! colspan="4"| Films |- ! ''Ignition'' ! Extra - Ano Orokamono ni mo Kyakkou wo! }} {{Infobox animanga/Game | title = Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku o! -Kono Yokubukai Game ni Shinpan o!- | developer = [[5pb.]] | publisher = 5pb.
[[Ubisoft]] | genre = [[Visual novel]] | platforms = [[PlayStation Vita]], [[PlayStation 4]] | released = September 7, 2017{{cite web|url=http://gematsu.com/2017/05/konosuba-game-ps4-ps-vita-launches-september-7-japan|title=KonoSuba game for PS4, PS Vita launches September 7 in Japan - Gematsu|author=|date=10 May 2017|website=gematsu.com|accessdate=10 May 2017}} }} {{Infobox animanga/Video | type = film | title = Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku o! Kurenai Densetsu | director = Takaomi Kanasaki | producer = | writer = [[Makoto Uezu]] | music = Masato Kōda | studio = [[J.C.Staff]] | licensee = | released = 2019 | runtime = }} {{Infobox animanga/Footer}} {{nihongo|'''''KonoSuba: God's Blessing on this Wonderful World!'''''|この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！|Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku o!|literally "A blessing to this wonderful world!"|lead=yes}} is a Japanese [[light novel]] series written by Natsume Akatsuki. The series follows a boy who is sent to a fantasy world following his death, forming a dysfunctional party with a goddess, a wizard, and a crusader to fight against monsters. Beginning as a [[web novel]] series published on ''[[Shousetsuka ni Narou]]'' between December 2012 and October 2013, the series was revised into a printed [[light novel]] series with illustrations by Kurone Mishima, which began publication under [[Kadokawa Shoten]]'s ''[[Kadokawa Sneaker Bunko]]'' [[Imprint (trade name)|Imprint]] from October 2013. A [[manga]] adaptation, illustrated by Masahito Watari and Joseph Yokobori, began serialization in [[Fujimi Shobo]]'s ''[[Monthly Dragon Age]]'' magazine from October 2014. A radio [[drama CD]] was released by HobiRecords in March 2015, and an [[anime]] television adaptation by [[Studio Deen]] aired in Japan between January and March 2016. A second season of the anime aired between January and March 2017.{{cite web|url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-03-16/konosuba-anime-gets-2nd-season/.99855|title=KonoSuba Anime Gets 2nd Season|date=March 16, 2016|website=[[Anime News Network]]|accessdate=March 16, 2016}}{{cite web |url=http://nagamedigital.com/2016/11/14/konosuba-season-2-release-date/|title=KONOSUBA SEASON 2 GETS OFFICIAL RELEASE DATE, PV AND KEY VISUAL|date=November 14, 2016 |website=nagamedigital.com|accessdate=November 14, 2016 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/daily-briefs/2016-06-24/konosuba-tv-anime-2nd-season-premieres-in-january/.103579 |title=KonoSuba TV Anime's 2nd Season Premieres in January |date=June 24, 2016 |website=[[Anime News Network]] |accessdate=June 24, 2016 }} A spin-off light novel series, ''Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Bakuen o!'', began publication from July 2014. Both the light novels and the manga are licensed in North America by [[Yen Press]]. An anime film adaptation by [[J.C.Staff]] titled ''Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku o! Kurenai Densetsu'' will premiere in 2019. ==Plot== {{See also|List of KonoSuba characters}} Following an untimely and embarrassing death, Kazuma Satō, a Japanese teenager [[hikikomori|shut-in]] [[NEET]], meets a goddess named Aqua, who offers to reincarnate him in a [[parallel universe (fiction)|parallel world]] with [[Massively multiplayer online role-playing game|MMORPG]] elements, where he can go on adventures and battle monsters. Despite being offered a superpowered item or ability to use in this new world, Kazuma, following some provocation, chooses Aqua herself to accompany him to the town of Axel, quickly finding her absent-mindedness to be less than beneficial.{{ref|LN|LN 1.P}} With Aqua unable to return to the afterlife until the [[Dark Lord (fiction)|Devil King]] is defeated, the two form a [[Party (role-playing games)|party]] and recruit two other members; an explosion-obsessed magician named Megumin and a masochistic crusader named Darkness.{{ref|LN|LN 1.2.4}} Due to the party's dysfunctional abilities, Kazuma quickly gives up on the idea of defeating the Devil King and tries to live a luxurious lifestyle, only to find the circumstances of his daily life are forcing him and his party to encounter and battle the Devil King's generals.{{ref|LN|LN 2.3}} ==Media== ===Novels=== {{See also|List of KonoSuba volumes#Light novels}} The original [[web novel]] series written by Natsume Akatsuki was published on Syosetu between December 2012 and October 2013.{{cite web| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131127132412/http://ncode.syosetu.com/n7145bl/| archivedate=November 27, 2013| url=http://ncode.syosetu.com/n7145bl/| title=KonoSuba web novel| publisher=Syosetu| language=Japanese| accessdate=February 8, 2016}} The author also wrote a side story featuring [[#Wiz|Wiz]] and Vanir.{{cite web| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130729143507/http://ncode.syosetu.com/n7364bo/| archivedate=July 29, 2013| url=http://ncode.syosetu.com/n7145bl/| title=The Masked Demon's Dream Watching| publisher=Syosetu| language=Japanese| accessdate=February 8, 2016}} Akatsuki, who enjoyed playing fantasy video games like ''[[Wizardry]]'' and ''[[Final Fantasy]]'', also derived much of ''KonoSuba''{{'s}} fantasy elements from [[tabletop role-playing game]]s.{{cite web|last=Green|first=Scott|url=http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-news/2017/04/26-1/the-anime-man-interviews-konosuba-creator|title=The Anime Man Interviews "Konosuba" Creator|publisher=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=April 26, 2017|accessdate=September 1, 2017}} A [[light novel]] version with illustrations by Kurone Mishima began release under [[Kadokawa Shoten]]'s [[Kadokawa Sneaker Bunko]] [[Imprint (trade name)|imprint]] from October 1, 2013,{{cite web| url=http://sneakerbunko.jp/bookdetails/index.php?pcd=321307000151| script-title=ja:この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！| publisher=[[Kadokawa Shoten]]| accessdate=May 30, 2015| language=Japanese}} with thirteen volumes released as of December 1, 2017.{{cite web| url=http://sneakerbunko.jp/bookdetails/index.php?pcd=321706000257| script-title=ja:この素晴らしい世界に祝福を!13| publisher=[[Kadokawa Shoten]]| accessdate=January 20, 2018| language=Japanese}} The light novel diverges significantly from the web novel's plot from the sixth volume onwards,{{citation needed|date=August 2017}} and also features changes to the characters' ages. A Megumin-focused [[Spin-off (media)|spin-off]] light novel series, also written and illustrated by Akatsuki and Mishima respectively, titled {{nihongo3|lit. "Give Explosions to This Wonderful World!"|この素晴らしい世界に爆焔を！|Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Bakuen wo!}} and takes place a year prior to the main series, began release from July 1, 2014, with three volumes released as of June 1, 2015.{{cite web| url=http://sneakerbunko.jp/bookdetails/index.php?pcd=321403000163|script-title=ja:この素晴らしい世界に爆焔を！|publisher=[[Kadokawa Shoten]]|accessdate=June 6, 2015|language=Japanese}} A sequel novel was released December 28, 2016,{{cite web| url=http://sneakerbunko.jp/bookdetails/index.php?pcd=321607000363 |script-title=ja:続・この素晴らしい世界に爆焔を！ |publisher=[[Kadokawa Shoten]] |accessdate=February 11, 2017 |language=Japanese}} named {{nihongo3|lit. "Sequel: Give Explosions to This Wonderful World!"|続・この素晴らしい世界に爆焔を！|Zoku: Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Bakuen wo!}}. Another spin-off featuring Vanir was published on April 1, 2016, called {{nihongo3|lit. "Consulting with the Masked Devil!"|この仮面の悪魔に相談を！|Kono Kamen no Akuma ni Sōdan wo!}}.{{cite web| url=http://sneakerbunko.jp/bookdetails/index.php?pcd=321601000557|script-title=ja:この仮面の悪魔に相談を！|publisher=[[Kadokawa Shoten]]|accessdate=June 30, 2016|language=Japanese}} Written by Hirukuma and illustrated by Uihime Hagure, a third spin-off is published since August 1, 2017, it is titled {{nihongo3|lit. "Bless Me in This Wonderful World! Extra: Attention Also to That Fool!"|この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！エクストラ あの愚か者にも脚光を！|Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo! Extra Ano Orokamono ni mo Kyakkou wo!}}.{{cite web|url=http://sneakerbunko.jp/bookdetails/index.php?pcd=321703000426|title=この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！エクストラ あの愚か者にも脚光を！|publisher=[[Kadokawa Shoten]]|accessdate=January 29, 2018|language=Japanese}} The second volume was released on December 1, 2017.{{cite web|url=http://sneakerbunko.jp/bookdetails/index.php?pcd=321703000427|title=この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！エクストラ あの愚か者にも脚光を！2|publisher=[[Kadokawa Shoten]]|accessdate=January 29, 2018|language=Japanese}} [[Yen Press]] announced on May 20, 2016 that it had licensed the light novels for release in North America.{{cite web |url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-05-20/yen-press-licenses-konosuba-death-march-to-the-parallel-world-rhapsody-manga-light-novels/.102332 |title=Yen Press Licenses Konosuba, Death March to the Parallel World Rhapsody Manga, Light Novels |date=May 20, 2016 |website=[[Anime News Network]] |accessdate=May 20, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170702032320/http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-05-20/yen-press-licenses-konosuba-death-march-to-the-parallel-world-rhapsody-manga-light-novels/.102332|archivedate=July 2, 2017}} The first volume was released in conjunction with the second manga volume on February 21, 2017.{{cite web|url=http://yenpress.com/2017/02/konosuba-gods-blessing-on-this-hilariously-frustrating-world/|title=Konosuba: God's Blessing on This Hilariously Frustrating World|work=[[Yen Press]]|date=February 21, 2017|accessdate=August 27, 2017}} ===Manga=== {{See also|List of KonoSuba volumes#Manga}} A [[manga]] adaption of ''KonoSuba'' illustrated by Masahito Watari began serialization in the October 2014 issue of [[Fujimi Shobo]]'s ''[[Monthly Dragon Age]]'' magazine on September 9, 2014.{{cite web| url=http://natalie.mu/comic/news/125663| title=''Omamori Himari'', Milan Matra's New Series| publisher=[[Natalie (website)|Natalie]]| date=September 9, 2014| accessdate=October 30, 2015| language=Japanese}} Five ''tankōbon'' volumes have been released as of March 2017. A spin-off manga, ''A Spotlight For (Even) This fool! Gifting this Wonderful World with Blessings! Extra'', was released as a bundle with the twelfth light novel volume. Written and illustrated by [[Kuma Hiru]] and [[Hagure Yuki]], respectively, it follows the story of Dust, who finds himself in trouble with Vanir over selling stolen products.{{cite web|last=Green|first=Scott|url=http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-news/2017/06/16/konosuba-anticipates-humiliation-a-new-ova-and-cover-previews|title="Konosuba" Anticipates Humiliation, a New OVA and Cover Previews|publisher=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=June 16, 2017|accessdate=September 1, 2017}} Yen Press announced its acquisition of the manga adaptation at the same time that it licensed the original light novels. ===Anime=== {{See also|List of KonoSuba episodes}} An [[anime]] television adaptation by [[Studio Deen]]{{cite web| url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2015-05-25/kono-subarashii-sekai-ni-shukufuku-o-alternate-world-comedy-light-novels-get-tv-anime/.88540| title=''KonoSuba'' TV Anime Announcement| publisher=[[Anime News Network]]| date=May 25, 2015| accessdate=May 25, 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170626203637/https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2015-05-25/kono-subarashii-sekai-ni-shukufuku-o-alternate-world-comedy-light-novels-get-tv-anime/.88540|archivedate=June 26, 2017}} aired on [[Tokyo MX]] between January 14, 2016, and March 16, 2016;{{cite web| url=https://konosuba.com/onair/| title=''KonoSuba'' Network Information| publisher=KonoSuba.com| language=Japanese| accessdate=January 29, 2016|quote=TOKYO MX – 1月13日より毎週水曜 – 25:05 ～ 25:35}} later broadcasting on eight other networks and several [[video on demand]] [[streaming media|streaming networks]]. The series was simulcast by [[Crunchyroll]] in several regions such as North America,{{cite web| url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-01-12/crunchyroll-to-stream-konosuba-god-blessing-on-this-wonderful-world-anime/.97499| title=Crunchyroll to Stream KonoSuba| date=January 12, 2016| publisher=[[Anime News Network]]| accessdate=February 1, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170728231301/https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-01-12/crunchyroll-to-stream-konosuba-god-blessing-on-this-wonderful-world-anime/.97499|archivedate=July 28, 2017}} and by [[AnimeLab]] in Australia.{{cite web| url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2015-12-22/new-titles-for-animelab-2016-winter-simulcast-season/.96781| title=New Titles for AnimeLab 2016 Winter Simulcast Season| date=December 21, 2015| publisher=[[Anime News Network]]| accessdate=February 8, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170729011400/https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2015-12-22/new-titles-for-animelab-2016-winter-simulcast-season/.96781|archivedate=July 29, 2017}} The series was directed by Takaomi Kanasaki and written by [[Makoto Uezu]] with character designs by Koichi Kikuta. An [[original video animation]] (OVA) was bundled with the ninth light novel of ''KonoSuba'' in June 2016.{{cite web|url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2015-12-21/kono-subarashii-sekai-ni-shukufuku-o-light-novel-bundles-original-anime-blu-ray/.96791| title=''KonoSuba'' Light Novel Bundles Original Anime Blu-ray| publisher=[[Anime News Network]]| date=December 21, 2015| accessdate=December 21, 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170726160432/https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2015-12-21/kono-subarashii-sekai-ni-shukufuku-o-light-novel-bundles-original-anime-blu-ray/.96791|archivedate=July 26, 2017}} The anime's opening theme is "Fantastic Dreamer" by [[Machico (singer)|Machico]] while the ending theme is {{nihongo|"Chīsana Bōken-sha"|ちいさな冒険者||lit."Little Adventurer"}} performed by [[Sora Amamiya]], [[Rie Takahashi]], and [[Ai Kayano]].{{cite web| url=http://konosuba.com/staff_cast/| title=KonoSuba anime staff| publisher=KonoSuba.com| language=Japanese| accessdate=January 31, 2016}} The series was animated by Koichi Kikuta and Momoka Komatsu, with the former working on odd-numbered episodes and the latter on even-numbered. While Komatsu's character designs closely resembled those of the light novels and had more attractive appearances, Kikuta based his designs on children's shows like ''[[Pokémon (anime)|Pokémon]]'' as he felt ''KonoSuba''{{'s}} story was similar to those found in such shows. A second season premiered on January 12, 2017. The second season's opening theme is "Tomorrow" by Machico, and the ending theme is {{nihongo|"Ouchi ni Kaeritai"|お家に帰りたい||lit."Want to Go Home"}} by Amamiya, Takahashi, and Kayano.{{cite web|title=KonoSuba 2 Anime's Promo Video Previews Machico's Opening Theme|url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-12-12/konosuba-2-anime-promo-video-previews-machico-opening-theme/.109782|publisher=[[Anime News Network]]|accessdate=December 13, 2016|date=December 12, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170731160957/https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-12-12/konosuba-2-anime-promo-video-previews-machico-opening-theme/.109782|archivedate=July 31, 2017}} A second OVA was bundled with the twelfth volume of ''KonoSuba'' in July 2017.{{cite web|url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-12-26/konosuba-light-novel-to-bundle-original-anime-blu-ray/.110350|title=KonoSuba Light Novel to Bundle Original Anime Blu-ray|publisher=[[Anime News Network]]|date=December 26, 2016|accessdate=December 26, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170731004431/http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-12-26/konosuba-light-novel-to-bundle-original-anime-blu-ray/.110350|archivedate=July 31, 2017}} On July 25, 2017, [[Jun Fukushima]] and Takahashi, the voice actors of Kazuma and Megumin respectively, announced plans for a new ''KonoSuba'' anime project.{{cite web |url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2017-07-25/konosuba-comedy-fantasy-anime-gets-new-anime-project/.119285 |title=KonoSuba Comedy Fantasy Anime Gets New Anime Project |date=July 25, 2017 |website=[[Anime News Network]] |accessdate=January 20, 2018 }}{{cite web|last=Green|first=Scott|url=http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-news/2017/07/25-1/new-konosuba-anime-project-announced|title=New "Konosuba" Anime Project Announced|publisher=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=July 25, 2017|accessdate=August 26, 2017}} On October 6, 2018, it was announced that characters from ''KonoSuba'' would appear in ''[[Isekai Quartet]]'', a crossover anime also featuring characters from ''[[Re:Zero − Starting Life in Another World]]'', ''[[Overlord (novel series)|Overlord]]'', and ''[[The Saga of Tanya the Evil]]''.{{cite web |url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2018-10-06/new-isekai-quartet-anime-project-crosses-over-overlord-re-zero-tanya-konosuba-franchises/.137803 |title=New Isekai Quartet Anime Project Crosses Over Overlord, Re:Zero, Tanya, Konosuba Franchises |date=October 6, 2018 |website=Anime News Network |accessdate=October 14, 2018 }} ===Video games=== A PC [[video game]] developed by game creator Tachi, titled {{nihongo|''Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku o! In The Life''|この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！in the life}}, is bundled with the first Blu-ray Disc/DVD volume of the anime series on March 25, 2016.{{cite web |url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-02-13/konosuba-1st-blu-ray-dvd-to-include-pc-game/.98637 |title=KonoSuba's 1st Blu-ray/DVD to Include PC Game |date=February 13, 2016 |website=[[Anime News Network]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170802002325/http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-02-13/konosuba-1st-blu-ray-dvd-to-include-pc-game/.98637|archivedate=August 2, 2017}} The game is developed using the software [[RPG Maker VX]].{{cite web|title=Blu-ray限定版&DVD限定版　第1巻　超豪華5大特典！！|url=http://konosuba.com/1st/bd/?mode=detail&id=bd1|website=アニメ『この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！』公式サイト|publisher=Kadokawa Corporation|accessdate=August 21, 2016|language=Japanese}} Another video game, created by Team Ladybug and Krobon, titled ''KonoSuba: God's Blessing on this Wonderful World! Revival of Beldia'' ({{nihongo|''Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku o! Fukatsu no Verdier''|この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！復活のベルディア}}) is bundled with the limited edition of first Blu-ray Disc/DVD volume of the anime series' second season and was released on April 28, 2017.{{cite web|title=「この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！２」 Blu-ray & DVD 第1巻|url=http://konosuba.com/bd/?mode=detail&id=bd1|website=アニメ『この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！2』公式サイト|accessdate=March 30, 2017|language=Japanese}} The game is a [[side-scrolling video game|side-scroller]] with gameplay resembling the ''[[Mega Man (video game)|Mega Man]]'' series.{{cite web|url=https://www.siliconera.com/2017/02/01/konosubas-season-2-limited-blu-ray-bonus-sweet-mega-man-style-side-scroller/|title=KonoSuba's Season 2 Limited Blu-ray Bonus Is A Sweet Mega Man-Style Side-Scroller|publisher=Siliconera|date=February 1, 2017|accessdate=August 25, 2017}} A visual novel adaptation for [[PlayStation Vita]] and [[PlayStation 4]], ''KonoSuba: God's Blessing on this Wonderful World! Judgment on this Greedy Game!'' ({{nihongo|''Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku o! -Kono Yokubukai Game ni Shinpan o!-''|この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！ -この欲深いゲームに審判を！-}}), was developed by [[5pb.]], published by [[Ubisoft]] and was released in Japan on September 7, 2017.{{cite web|url=https://www.siliconera.com/2017/05/10/konosubas-new-game-releases-september-7-japan-comes-bonus-konosuba-shooting-game/v|title=KonoSuba's New Game Releases September 7 In Japan, Comes With Bonus KonoSuba Shooting Game|work=Siliconera|date=May 10, 2017|accessdate=August 26, 2017}} The game features an original story, in which Kazuma discovers a cursed ring that allows him to steal the underwear of others near him. He learns the only way to undo the curse would be through raising enough money. ''Judgment on this Greedy Game!'' introduces an "Underwear Judgment" system, where the player assists Kazuma in returning lost underwear to their rightful owner.{{cite web|last=Romano|first=Sal|title=KonoSuba game launches for PS4 and PS Vita this summer in Japan|url=https://gematsu.com/2017/03/konosuba-game-launches-ps4-ps-vita-summer-japan|publisher=Gematsu|accessdate=March 30, 2017}} Like the anime, Machico performed the opening ("Million Smile"), while Amamiya, Takahashi, and Kayano sang the game's ending theme ("101 Pikime no Hitsuji").{{cite web|last=Green|first=Scott|url=http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-news/2017/07/23/hear-cast-and-machico-sing-konosuba-game-themes|title=Hear Cast And Machico Sing "Konosuba" Game Themes|publisher=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=July 23, 2017|accessdate=August 26, 2017}} ===Film=== On June 25, 2018, a film adaptation titled was announced to be in development at [[J.C.Staff]]. The cast and staff are set to reprise their roles from the TV series.{{cite web |last1=Hodgkins |first1=Crystalyn |title=Konosuba - God's Blessing on This Wonderful World! Anime Gets Film Project |url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2018-06-25/konosuba-god-blessing-on-this-wonderful-world-anime-gets-film-project/.133376 |website=Anime News Network |accessdate=June 25, 2018 |date=June 25, 2018}} The film is titled {{nihongo|''Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku o! Kurenai Densetsu''|この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！紅伝説}},{{cite web |title=『この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！紅伝説』ティザービジュアル公開！ |url=https://konosuba.com/2nd/news/?mode=detail&id=20181104_1 |publisher=[[Kadokawa Corporation]] |accessdate=November 5, 2018 |language=Japanese |date=November 5, 2018}} and is scheduled to premiere in 2019.{{cite web|last1=Hodgkins |first1=Crystalyn|url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/daily-briefs/2018-10-20/konosuba-god-blessing-on-this-wonderful-world-anime-film-opens-in-2019/.138430|title=KONOSUBA - God's blessing on this wonderful world! Anime Film Opens in 2019|date=October 20, 2018|publisher=Anime News Network|accessdate=October 20, 2018}} ===Other media=== A radio [[drama CD]], featuring a different voice cast to the anime, was released by HobiRecords on March 1, 2015.{{cite web| url=https://www.toranoana.jp/info/dojin/konosuba/| title=KonoSuba Drama CD| publisher=[[Comic Toranoana]]| language=Japanese| accessdate=January 29, 2016}} A second drama CD, along with an original soundtrack by [[Kouda Masato]] and a [[character song]] album, was released in March 2017.{{cite web|url=https://otakumode.com/news/5891ab30e088942e19129b4f/March-Is-KonoSuba-Month-New-Original-Soundtrack-Drama-CD-Character-Song-Album-Slated-for-Release!|title=March Is KonoSuba Month - New Original Soundtrack, Drama CD & Character Song Album Slated for Release!|work=Tokyo Otaku Mode News|date=February 2, 2017|accessdate=August 26, 2017}} ==Reception== The ''KonoSuba'' light novels have been quite popular. As of March 2, 2016, the 11-volume series has a total of 1.5 million copies in print, each volume selling 136,000 copies.{{cite web|url=http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-news/2016/03/02/konosuba-novel-sales-increases-three-times-thanks-to-tv-anime|title='KonoSuba' Novel Sales Increases Three Times Thanks to TV Anime|publisher=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=March 2, 2016|first=Mikikazu|last=Komatsu}} As of February 2017, the light novels had three million copies in print.{{cite web|last=Green|first=Scott|url=https://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-news/2017/02/03/konosuba-art-book-commercial-explodes-online|title="Konosuba" Art Book Commercial Explodes Online|publisher=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=February 3, 2017|accessdate=August 26, 2017}} In a review of the first novel, Andy Hanley praised the series' comedy reflected in the "tired genre" as well as its cast finding them appealing based on their traits. However, Hanley criticized the short length of the first volume.{{cite web |url=http://www.uk-anime.net/manga/Konosuba:_God's_Blessing_on_This_Wonderful_World!_-_Vol._1_(Light_novel).html |title=MANGA REVIEW: Konosuba: God's Blessing on This Wonderful World! - Vol. 1 (Light novel) |last=Hanley |first=Andy|date=February 28, 2017 |website=UK Anime|accessdate=April 11, 2017}} The series won [[BookWalker]]'s 2016 Grand Prix Award.{{cite web|last=Komatsu|first=Mikizaku|url=https://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-news/2017/02/03/konosuba-gods-blessing-on-this-wonderful-world-wins-book-walker-grand-prix-award-2016|title="KONOSUBA -God's blessing on this wonderful world!" Wins Book Walker Grand Prix Award 2016|publisher=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=February 3, 2017|accessdate=September 1, 2017}} {{quote box|align=right|width=25em|quote=''KonoSuba: God's Blessing on This Wonderful World'' is an anime that has a lot of fun mocking the tropes of the typical JRPG fantasy world via a colorful cast of characters that are enjoyable in their own right. The comedy is so spot-on with its deadpan nature that it's hard not to be drawn in by that alone.|source=– Richard Eisenbeis, in his review of the anime}} Like its light novel counterpart, the anime has received positive reception for its comedy, parody of the "trapped in a fantasy world" subgenre, and faithful adaptation of the light novels. Reviewing the first few episodes, [[Anime News Network]] (ANN)'s Theron Martin described the second episode as "the funniest episode of anime I have seen since ''[[Monthly Girls' Nozaki-kun]]'' aired", while also praising the series' musical score.{{cite web |url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/review/konosuba-god-blessing-on-this-wonderful-world/episodes-1-2/.97800 |title=KonoSuba – God's blessing on this wonderful world!! Episodes 1-2 |last=Martin |first=Theron |date=January 21, 2016 |website=[[Anime News Network]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170802104838/http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/review/konosuba-god-blessing-on-this-wonderful-world/episodes-1-2/.97800|archivedate=August 2, 2017}} The voice acting has also been a subject of praise; Nick Creamer of ANN commended Sora Amamiya and Rie Takahashi's roles as Aqua and Megumin for the energy provided in their performances, while Martin applauded Jun Fukushima for his work in voicing Kazuma, considering his dry tone an additional factor in the show's humor.{{cite web|last=Martin|first=Theron|url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/review/konosuba-god-blessing-on-this-wonderful-world-2/episode-7/.112580|title=KONOSUBA - God's blessing on this wonderful world! 2 - Episode 7|publisher=[[Anime News Network]]|date=February 23, 2017|accessdate=September 1, 2017|quote=Week in and week out, Jun Fukushima knocks it out of the park with his perfectly-measured rendition of Kazuma. In every scene, his inflection and tone is exactly right to milk the maximum value out of a scene's comedy potential. ... The female seiyuu are nailing their roles too, but many scenes in this series wouldn't be half as funny without Kazuma's dry wit as the slightly-less-crazy center of a crazy maelstrom.}} In contrast, a common criticism of the anime was its inconsistent character animation, one that was described as "low budget" as characters appeared [[off-model]].{{cite web|last=Morrissy|first=Kim|url=http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-feature/2017/02/27-1/feature-novel-vs-anime-konosuba|title=FEATURE: Novel vs Anime - "Konosuba"|publisher=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=February 27, 2017|accessdate=August 25, 2017}} Koichi Kikuta responded by stating such design was intentional, hoping to "bring out the individuality of each character" rather than the prettier artwork in the light novels; to do this, Kikuta's animation displayed "their more human sides, like their unflattering traits and their distressed moments."{{cite web|url=https://wavemotioncannon.com/2017/02/07/konosuba-interview-with-koichi-kikuta-anime-style-009-july-2016/|title=Konosuba Interview with Koichi Kikuta (Anime Style 009, July 2016)|work=Wave Motion Cannon|date=February 7, 2017|accessdate=August 25, 2017}} [[Crunchyroll]]'s Kim Morrissy considered the animation to be humorous, especially fitting in a comedic anime. [[Kotaku]] writer Richard Eisenbeis explained much of the series' humor derives from the deconstruction of Kazuma's hopes of becoming the hero of a fantasy world, instead realizing he is forced to struggle his way through the world.{{cite web|last=Eisenbeis|first=Richard|url=https://kotaku.com/when-your-new-life-in-a-jrpg-world-doesn-t-live-up-to-e-1778353269|title=When Your New Life in a JRPG World Doesn't Live Up to Expectations|publisher=[[Kotaku]]|date=May 26, 2016|accessdate=August 25, 2017}} Comparing Kazuma's problems in a fantasy world to those in real life, Creamer wrote about a sense of relatability between the series' protagonists and the audience, as the party deals with issues like debt and taking questionable jobs because of high pay. On a critical note, Creamer disapproved of Kazuma's negative attitude, which he felt harmed the comedy in the series.{{cite web|last=Creamer|first=Nick|url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/review/konosuba-god-blessing-on-this-wonderful-world-episodes-1-10-streaming/.100209|title=KonoSuba – God's Blessing on This Wonderful World! [Episodes 1-10 Streaming]|publisher=[[Anime News Network]]|date=March 25, 2016|accessdate=August 30, 2017}} ''KonoSuba''{{'s}} characters, especially those in Kazuma's party, have gained favorable thoughts in the anime community. Creamer described the group as possessing a "strange but endearing chemistry," as the members are unfriendly with one another, yet are close. Morrissy added the party's "emotional bond is also evident in the ways they interact with each other. My favorite thing about the anime is that it takes the time to draw these nuances out onscreen and express them with visual flair." Megumin in particular has been considered one of the series' most popular characters, winning Sneaker Bunko's official Favorite ''KonoSuba'' Character poll.{{cite web|url=https://sneakerbunko.jp/special/konosuba-charavote/index.php|title=KonoSuba Character Poll|work=[[Kadokawa Sneaker Bunko]]|accessdate=September 1, 2017|language=Japanese}} She was also the sixth-highest vote in ''[[Newtype]]''{{'s}} 2015–16 Awards for Best Female Character (Kazuma was third in the male category) and received the most "Other" votes in the Best Girl category in [[Crunchyroll]]'s Anime Awards 2016.{{cite web|last=Green|first=Scott|url=http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-news/2016/10/09/japanese-fans-pick-favorite-anime-from-last-twelve-months-in-newtype-awards|title=Japanese Fans Pick Favorite Anime From Last Twelve Months In Newtype Awards|publisher=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=October 9, 2016|accessdate=September 1, 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-feature/2017/01/10-1/feature-crunchyroll-anime-awards-the-results-are-in-see-who-won|title=FEATURE: Crunchyroll Anime Awards - The Results are In! See Who Won!|work=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=January 10, 2017|accessdate=September 1, 2017}} In an interview with internet personality The Anime Man, Natsume Akatsuki described Megumin as giving off "a pure and elegant atmosphere" like one of an anime heroine or [[waifu]], hence her popularity among fans. In 2016, the anime was voted the tenth-best TV anime in the ''Newtype'' 2015–16 Awards. ''KonoSuba'' also finished runner-up for Best Comedy in the Anime Awards 2016 to ''[[Haven't You Heard? I'm Sakamoto]]''. ==Notes== *{{note|LN|LN}} represents the Light Novel of the series in the format of X.Y.Z, where X represents the volume, Y represents the chapter, and Z represents the part. Chapter P represents the [[prologue]] while chapter A represents the [[afterword]] of the novel. Ex. and M. refer to the ''Explosions'' (''Sekai ni Bakuen o!'') and ''Consulting with the Masked Devil'' (''Kono Kamen no Akuma ni Sōdan wo!'') spin-offs. ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== {{Commons category|KonoSuba}} *{{Official website|https://sneakerbunko.jp/series/konosuba/}} {{ja icon}} *{{Official website|https://konosuba.com/|Official anime website}} {{ja icon}} *{{Official website|https://www.fujimishobo.co.jp/sp/201504konosuba/|Official manga website}} {{ja icon}} *{{ann|light novel|18158}} {{Konosuba}} {{Studio Deen}} {{J.C.Staff}} [[Category:2013 Japanese novels]] [[Category:2014 Japanese novels]] [[Category:2016 anime OVAs]] [[Category:2016 Japanese novels]] [[Category:2017 video games]] [[Category:Anime and manga based on light novels]] [[Category:Comedy anime and manga]] [[Category:Crunchyroll]] [[Category:Fantasy anime and manga]] [[Category:Fujimi Shobo manga]] [[Category:Isekai anime and manga]] [[Category:J.C.Staff]] [[Category:Kadokawa Sneaker Bunko]] [[Category:Kadokawa Dwango franchises]] [[Category:Light novels]] [[Category:Light novels first published online]] [[Category:Media Factory manga]] [[Category:Media franchises]] [[Category:MMORPGs in fiction]] [[Category:Monarchy in fiction]] [[Category:Novels about the afterlife]] [[Category:Reincarnation in fiction]] [[Category:Screenplays by Makoto Uezu]] [[Category:Shōsetsuka ni Narō]] [[Category:Studio Deen]] [[Category:Shōnen manga]] [[Category:Television programs based on light novels]] [[Category:Tokyo MX shows]] [[Category:Upcoming animated films]] [[Category:Visual novels]] [[Category:Yen Press titles]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox media franchise |title = ''Leyendas'' |image = Leyendas.png |imagesize = 250px |caption = Spanish logo for the ''[[Legend Quest (2017 TV series)|Legend Quest]]'' series |creator = Ricardo Arnaiz{{cite news|last1=Gutiérrez|first1=Vicente|title=Ánima Estudios construye franquicia cinematográfica|url=https://www.eleconomista.com.mx/arteseideas/Anima-Estudios-construye-franquicia-cinematografica-20161018-0010.html|accessdate=20 February 2018|work=El Economista|publisher=El Economista|date=18 October 2016}} In Spanish. |owner = [[Ánima Estudios]] |films = {{Plainlist| * ''[[La Leyenda de la Nahuala]]'' (2007) * ''[[La Leyenda de la Llorona]]'' (2011) * ''[[La Leyenda de las Momias|La Leyenda de las Momias de Guanajuato]]'' (2014) * ''[[La Leyenda del Chupacabras]]'' (2016) * ''[[La Leyenda del Charro Negro]]'' (2018) }} |tv = {{Plainlist| * ''[[Legend Quest (2017 TV series)|Legend Quest]]'' (2017-present)}} |vgs = {{Plainlist| * ''Las Leyendas: El Pergamino Mágico''}} |soundtracks = }} '''''Leyendas''''' is an [[animation|animated]] [[comedy horror|horror-comedy]] [[film franchise]] created by Ricardo Arnaiz and produced by [[Mexico|Mexican]] [[animation studio]], [[Ánima Estudios]]. It consists of five films, a television series, and a gaming application. It centers on Leo San Juan, a heroic preteen boy who can communicate with ghosts and monsters, Teodora, a sassy preteen ghost girl with a know-it-all personality, Don Andrés, an amicable but loony old knight, [[Alebrije]], a mild-mannered mythological creature, and Finado and Moribunda, two charming [[calavera]] children.{{cite news|last1=Wolfe|first1=Jennifer|title=Anima Estudios’ ‘Legend Quest’ Debuts on Netflix This Friday!|url=http://www.awn.com/news/anima-estudios-legend-quest-debuts-netflix-friday|accessdate=19 February 2018|work=Animation World Network|publisher=Animation World Network|date=20 February 2017}} Each film is based on a Mexican legend, and are set during the 1800s timeline.{{cite news|last1=Gutiérrez|first1=Vicente|title=La leyenda de las momias..., animación a la mexicana|url=https://www.eleconomista.com.mx/arteseideas/La-leyenda-de-las-momias...-animacion-a-la-mexicana-20141029-0113.html|accessdate=19 February 2018|work=El Economista|publisher=El Economista|date=29 October 2014}} (in Spanish) The franchise began in 2007 with the release of ''[[La Leyenda de la Nahuala]]'', directed by creator Ricardo Arnaiz and produced by [[Puebla City|Puebla]]-based [[Animex Producciones]]. The film was later followed by ''[[La Leyenda de la Llorona]]'' in 2011, ''[[La Leyenda de las Momias|La Leyenda de las Momias de Guanajuato]]'' in 2014, ''[[La Leyenda del Chupacabras]]'' in 2016, and ''[[La Leyenda del Charro Negro]]'' in 2018, all of which are produced by [[Ánima Estudios]] and directed and co-written by Alberto Rodríguez. The franchise has also been spawned into a [[Netflix]] [[List of original programs distributed by Netflix|original series]], titled ''[[Legend Quest (2017 TV series)|Legend Quest]]''. It is the only film franchise in [[Mexico]], which is a rare instance within the [[Cinema of Mexico|country's domestic film industry]]. As such, the franchise has become widely popular within the country and often achieves successful box-office numbers, with ''[[La Leyenda del Chupacabras|Chupacabras]]'' currently being the highest-grossing film.{{cite news|last1=Valle Vargas|first1=Montserrat|title='LAS LEYENDAS': PRIMERA SERIE ANIMADA MEXICANA EN LLEGAR A NETFLIX|url=http://expansion.mx/tecnologia/2017/02/23/las-leyendas-primera-serie-animada-mexicana-en-llegar-a-netflix|accessdate=2 March 2017|work=[[Expansión (Mexico)|Expansión]]|publisher=[[Time, Inc.]]|date=20 February 2018}} ==Films== ===La Leyenda de la Nahuala (2007)=== {{further|La Leyenda de la Nahuala}} The first film, ''[[La Leyenda de la Nahuala]]'' was released on 1 November 2007 in [[Mexico]] with 350 copies, directed by Ricardo Arnaiz and produced by [[Animex Producciones]].{{cite news|last1=Estrada|first1=Frank|title=La Leyenda de la Nahuala|url=http://www.zocalo.com.mx/seccion/opinion-articulo/la-leyenda-de-la-nahuala|accessdate=20 February 2018|work=Zócalo|publisher=Grupo Zócalo|date=29 October 2011}} The film has performed well at the Mexican box-office, grossing a total of $42.2 million [[Mexican peso|pesos]] (US$4.03 million), which was one of the highest-grossing Mexican films at the time.{{cite web|title=Mexico Box Office April 25–27, 2008 (check "Gross-to-Date")|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/intl/mexico/?yr=2008&wk=17&pagenum=2¤cy=local&p=new|website=Box Office Mojo|publisher=Amazon.com|accessdate=7 February 2018}} Based on the 'Nahuala' legend and receiving the support of the state of [[Puebla]], the film is written by Omar Mustre and Antonio Garci, and features the voices of famous Mexican actors, including [[Andrés Bustamante]], [[Jesús Ochoa (actor)|Jesús Ochoa]], Rafael Inclán, [[Martha Higareda]], [[Manuel Valdés|Manuel 'Loco' Valdés]], and [[Pierre Angelo]].{{cite web|title=Scary legends Mexican style|url=http://www.tuvez.com/scary-legends-mexican-style/|website=TuVez|publisher=TuVez|accessdate=20 February 2018}} Set in 1807 at the city of [[Puebla City|Puebla de Los Angeles]], the film centers on Leo San Juan, a cowardly 9-year-old boy, summons the courage to rescue his older brother, Nando, from an abandoned house possessed by an evil witch, known as the 'Nahuala', with the aide of his new ghost friends.{{cite news|title=The Legend of the Nahuala|url=http://www.recorri2.com/english/the-legend-of-the-nahuala|accessdate=20 February 2018|work=Recorri2|publisher=Recorri2|date=25 February 2014}} The success of the film has launched a franchise, to which Arnaiz have given the license and characters to [[Ánima Estudios]]. ===La Leyenda de la Llorona (2011)=== {{further|La Leyenda de la Llorona}} A sequel, ''[[La Leyenda de la Llorona]]'', based on the [[La Llorona]] ("The Weeping Woman") legend figure, was released on 21 October 2011 with 225 to 300 copies.{{cite news|title=Leyenda de la Llorona haunts theaters – the movie will be released on October 21st 2011|url=https://animaestudios.com/en/leyenda-de-la-llorona-haunts-theaters-the-movie-will-be-released-on-october-21st-2011/|accessdate=20 February 2018|work=Anima Estudios News|publisher=Anima Estudios, S.A. de C.V.|date=1 October 2011}} Unlike its predecessor, it was produced by [[Ánima Estudios]] and directed and co-written by Alberto Rodríguez, which he and the company have taken over the production of further films. Additionally, the film also uses [[flash animation]] for the film and its successors (excluding ''Chupacabras''; see below). The film is written by Ricardo Arnaiz, the predecessor's director, Jesús Guzmán, and Omar Mustre, who also written the preceding film. Some of the previous film's voice cast reprise their roles, while some actors, such as [[Andrés Bustamante]], were replaced by new voice actors. The film picks up from ''Nahuala'' and follows the new adventures of Leo San Juan with his gang, Don Andrés, Alebrije, Teodora, Finado and Moribunda. Taking place in ancient [[Xochimilco]], Leo falls out of the crew's ship where he meets a young village girl, named Kika, who is on her journey to find her lost brother, Beto, where they encounter the 'Llorona', while the rest of his gang end up in the La Isla de las Munecas ('Puppets' Island').{{cite news|title=La Leyenda de la Llorona recauda mas de 8 mdp|url=http://archivo.eluniversal.com.mx/notas/803947.html|accessdate=20 February 2018|work=El Universal|publisher=El Universal|date=25 October 2011}} In Spanish. The film did not receive support from any Mexican state. It was another box-office success, earning $8 million pesos on its opening weekend, and grossing a total of $55.3 million pesos (US$2.9 million), performing better than its predecessor.{{cite news|last1=Gutiérrez|first1=Vicente|title=La Leyenda del Charro Negro triunfa en la taquilla|url=https://www.eleconomista.com.mx/arteseideas/La-Leyenda-del-Charro-Negro-triunfa-en-la-taquilla-20180129-0067.html|accessdate=31 January 2018|work=El Economista|publisher=Periódico El Economista S.A. de C.V.|date=19 February 2018}} In Spanish. ===La Leyenda de las Momias de Guanajuato (2014)=== {{further|La Leyenda de las Momias}} The third film, ''[[La Leyenda de las Momias|La Leyenda de las Momias de Guanajuato]]'', was released on 30 October 2014 with 700 copies in regular and [[4DX]] formats, a first for a Mexican film. The film is a fictionalization of the origin of the [[mummy|mummies]], notably from the [[Mummies of Guanajuato|Guanajuato]] region. It follows Leo San Juan and his gang now trying to find Xóchitl in [[Guanajuato City|Guanajuato]] who was kidnapped by Rosseau, an old wizard who has the ability to awaken the mummies from the dead. Along the way, Leo teams up with Valentina, disguised as her alter-ego Luis, who is on her own journey to find her father. Director Alberto Rodríguez returns to direct for the second time, and makes his writing debut, alongside with the screenplay by Jesús Guzmán, Ricardo Arnaiz, and Dulce María Guerrero. ''Momias'' was not produced with the support of the Mexican federal government, due to disapproval; however, it did receive support from the state government of [[Guanajuato]]. Despite the lack of national support, ''Momias'' is a major box-office success, and the first in the series to surpass $50 million pesos; grossing a total of $92.2 million pesos (US$4.9 million). As the voice cast from ''Llorona'' reunites for the third film, among the newcomers is Benny Emmanuel, known for ''[[La CQ]]'', as the voice of Leo San Juan, who has been the present voice actor for the character since ''Momias''. Alongside, Eduardo "Lalo" España, a Mexican actor and comedian, joins the franchise cast as the new character, Evaristo, an [[alebrije]] with a smooth personality, while Alejandra Müller, a teen actress who is also an alumnus of ''[[La CQ]]'', voices Valentina, a girl who Leo helps find Rosseau.{{cite news|title=Ánima Estudios estrenará 'La leyenda de las momias de Guanajuato'|url=http://www.mvsnoticias.com/#!/noticias/anima-estudios-estrenara-la-leyenda-de-las-momias-de-guanajuato-736.html|accessdate=20 February 2018|work=MVS Noticas|publisher=MVS Radio|date=27 October 2014}} ===La Leyenda del Chupacabras (2016)=== {{further|La Leyenda del Chupacabras}} ''[[La Leyenda del Chupacabras]]'', the fourth film, was released on 21 October 2016. The story is based on the [[chupacabra]] creature. In the film, while on his way home to [[Puebla City|Puebla]], Leo and his fellow rebel mates get caught up in a civil war where they get locked up in [[Irapuato]]. When the 'chupacabra' invades the prison, Leo calls the help of his friend, Teodora, to discover the origin and arrival of the creature as he escapes with his inmates. The films' past characters, including Don Andrés and Xochitl, were left absent, while Fernando "Nando" San Juan, Leo's older brother from ''[[La Leyenda de la Nahuala|Nahuala]]'', makes a return to the franchise. The film also uses [[traditional animation]], which is the first time since ''Nahuala'' and the first during the [[Ánima Estudios]] era. In another series first, the film was released in the [[United States]] on 14 October 2016, one week prior to its release in Mexico. Distributed by [[Pantelion Films]], a major American film distributor for [[Latin America]]n-themed films, the film was shown in the original Spanish-language format with English subtitles.{{cite news|title=La leyenda de 'El Chupacabras'|url=http://www.univision.com/entretenimiento/avances/la-leyenda-de-el-chupacabras|accessdate=9 September 2016|work=Univision|publisher=Univision Communications Inc.|date=8 September 2016}} Despite receiving negative reviews, the film is another major box-office success, grossing a total of $100.7 million pesos (US$5.4 million), making it the highest-grossing film in the franchise and currently the only one to surpass the $100 million peso-mark.{{cite news|last1=Hopewell|first1=John|title=Fewer Juggernauts Push Mexico to All-Time Box Office Record (EXCLUSIVE)|url=https://variety.com/2017/film/festivals/fewer-juggernauts-mexico-2016-box-office-record-1202010054/|accessdate=20 February 2018|work=Variety (magazine)|publisher=Penske Business Media, LLC.|date=16 March 2017}} While the ''Momias'' voice cast return for the fourth film, Rafael Inclán did not return to voice Alebrije, where he was replaced by dubbing actor Herman López. ===La Leyenda del Charro Negro (2018)=== {{further|La Leyenda del Charro Negro}} ''[[La Leyenda del Charro Negro]]'', the fifth entry, was released on 19 January 2018, as opposed to previous films which were normally released on an October. It picks up from ''[[La Leyenda del Chupacabras|Chupacabras]]'' where Leo San Juan and his brother Nando head home to [[Puebla City|Puebla]]. Along the way, Leo encounters the 'Charro Negro' ("Black Charro") who confuses him and causes a girl to be cast into the underworld. He enlists the help of his friends to correct his mistakes and take on the 'Charro Negro' once and for all. ''Charro Negro'' marks the return of some of the past films' characters, such as Don Andrés and Xochitl, while also featuring cameos of other returning characters and references the entire franchise elements.{{cite news|last1=VÉRTIZ DE LA FUENTE|first1=COLUMBA|title="La leyenda del Charro Negro" en cines|url=http://www.proceso.com.mx/519861/la-leyenda-del-charro-negro-en-cines|accessdate=27 January 2018|work=Proceso (magazine)|publisher=Proceso Comunicación e Información S.A. de C.V.|date=24 January 2018}} In Spanish.{{cite news|last1=Ortiz|first1=Cesar Huerta|title=Alistan "La Leyenda del Charro Negro"|url=http://www.eluniversal.com.mx/articulo/espectaculos/cine/2017/06/8/alistan-la-leyenda-del-charro-negro|accessdate=20 February 2018|work=El Universal|publisher=El Universal|date=6 August 2017}} In Spanish. Along with the returning voice cast of the ''Momias'' and ''Chupacabras'', Mexican actor [[Erick Elías]] voices the 'Charro Negro'.{{cite news|last1=Rosa Camacho|first1=Alma|last2=Lopez|first2=Adolfo|title=Se estrena la cinta La leyenda del Charro Negro|url=https://www.diariodequeretaro.com.mx/gossip/celebridades/se-estrena-la-cinta-la-leyenda-del-charro-negro-563863.html|accessdate=28 January 2018|work=Diario de Queretaro|publisher=Editorial Organization Mexicana|date=16 January 2018}} In Spanish. ===Sequels and future of franchise=== While ''Charro Negro'' has been rumored to be the last film in the franchise, director Alberto Rodríguez has stated the possibility of a new film, due to the amount of potential and "many more doors to explore", but would require the creation of new characters.{{cite news|title=EL CHARRO NEGRO, ¿LA ÚLTIMA LEYENDA?|url=https://videocine.com.mx/noticia/charro-negro-la-ultima-leyenda/|accessdate=20 February 2018|work=Videocine Distrbucion Noticas|publisher=Televisa, S.A. de C.V.|date=2018}} In Spanish. (Note: date not shown on website) Andrés Couturier, the voice of Don Andrés and manager at [[Ánima Estudios]], said that he wouldn't be "surprised to see crossovers or spin-offs of ''Las Leyendas''." Rodríguez stated that ''Charro Negro'' would be his last film, as he has expressed interest in making new projects outside of the franchise. "I feel that my cycle is already finished in terms of [''Leyendas'']. I already want to do other things, but we are still involved in the development of other things that come for the ''Leyendas''," he said. It was announced on [[Twitter]] that another installment is confirmed.{{cite web |title=Cinepolis on Twitter: "¡Algo nuevo de @helloanima se está cocinando! Sigue al pendiente para descubrir nuevas noticias...." |url=https://twitter.com/Cinepolis/status/1062051492847267841 |website=Twitter |publisher=Cinepolis |accessdate=12 November 2018}} In Spanish. Date published: 12 November 2018. 10:36am. It is currently unknown whether the film will be a direct follow-up to Leo's past adventures or an entirely new film. ==Television series== {{further|Legend Quest (2017 TV series)}} A [[Netflix]] [[List of original programs distributed by Netflix|original series]] based on the characters, named ''[[Legend Quest (2017 TV series)|Legend Quest]]'' (a.k.a. ''Las Leyendas''), premiered in 2017 in 30 languages, making it the platform's first original animated series produced in [[Latin America]]. ==Voice cast (Spanish)== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%; width:99%;" |- ! rowspan="3" width="10%" | Characters ! colspan="5" | Films ! {{Infobox video game |title = Lord of Vermilion |image = LoV-KeyVis.jpg |image_size = 256px |caption = |composer = [[Nobuo Uematsu]], [[Hitoshi Sakimoto]], Tachytelic |developer = [[Think Garage]]{{cite web|url=http://www.thinkgarage.co.jp/products.html |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/60yLMglRw?url=http://www.thinkgarage.co.jp/products.html |archivedate=2011-08-16 |title=Think Garage Works History |author= |work= |date= |accessdate= |deadurl=yes |df= }} |publisher = [[Square Enix]] |designer = |series = |engine = |released = {{vgrelease|JP|June 17, 2008}} |genre = [[Fantasy]] [[collectible card game]] |modes = |platforms = [[Arcade game|Arcade]] |cabinet = |arcade system = [[Taito Type X|Taito Type X2 Satellite Terminal]] |cpu = [[LGA 775]]-based
[[Graphics processing unit|GPU]]: [[PCI Express]] ×16-based |sound = [[Realtek]] [[Intel High Definition Audio|HD]] [[7.1 surround sound|7.1-channel]] |display = [[720p]] }} {{nihongo|'''''Lord of Vermilion'''''|ロード・オブ・ヴァーミリオン|Rōdo obu Vāmirion}} is an [[arcade game|arcade]]-based [[fantasy]] [[collectible card game]] developed by Think Garage and distributed by [[Square Enix]]"''Lord of Vermilion'': Coin-based card combat," ''Electronic Gaming Monthly 225 (February 2008): ''24. in which players control combat cards on an arcade play surface. The objective of the game is to destroy the enemy team's Arcana Stones and eliminate their servants in order to win the game. Players design and develop [[Avatar (computing)|avatar]]s, increasing their statistics and obtaining equipment, then compete with each other locally, or online, or play the single player story mode. As of November 7, 2008, ''Lord of Vermilion'' has contributed over [[Japanese yen|¥]]4 billion in earnings for Square Enix.{{cite web | title=Outline of Results Briefing by SQUARE ENIX HOLDINGS held on November 7, 2008 | url=http://www.square-enix.com/eng/pdf/news/20081126en.pdf#page=4 | work=Square-Enix.com | accessdate=2008-12-20}} A sequel, ''Lord of Vermilion II'', was released in Japan on October 27, 2009, and was followed up by ''Lord of Vermilion Re:2'' on July 26, 2011. The sequels prominently featured collaborations with a number of other franchises and game series, including the ''[[Final Fantasy]]'', ''[[Romancing SaGa]]'', ''[[Magic: The Gathering]]'', ''[[The King of Fighters]]'', ''[[Touhou]]'' and ''[[BlazBlue]]''.{{cite web | title=Lord of Vermilion Re:2 Official Site: Collaboration | url=http://www.lordofv.com/collaboration/ | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120328061202/http://www.lordofv.com/collaboration/ | archivedate=2012-03-28 | df= }} It has also spawned a spinoff franchise of [[Action role-playing game|action RPG]] titles for the [[PlayStation Portable]] and [[PlayStation Vita]], including ''[[Lord of Arcana]]'' and ''[[Lord of Apocalypse]]''. Another sequel, ''Lord of Vermilion III'', was released on August 22, 2013.{{cite web|title=Square Enix Has Lord Of Vermilion III Set For Summer|url=http://www.siliconera.com/2013/01/31/square-enix-has-lord-of-vermilion-iii-set-for-summer/|accessdate=January 31, 2013}}{{cite web|title=Lord of Vermilion III|url=http://www.jp.square-enix.com/lov3/}} A [[free-to-play]] [[Third-person view|third person]] [[Action game|action]] [[multiplayer online battle arena]] (MOBA), ''Lord of Vermilion Arena'', was officially launched on June 17, 2015.{{cite web|title=Lord of Vermilion Arena|url=http://lova.jp/}} The servers were closed on June 30, 2016 http://news.mmosite.com/content/2016-05-17/lord_of_vermilion_arena_online_will_be_shut_down.shtml In [[Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn|Final Fantasy XIV]] a parody [[real-time strategy]] (RTS) game using in-game minions called Lord of Verminion was made in reference and parody to Lord of Vermilion on November 10, 2015.{{Cite web|url=http://na.finalfantasyxiv.com/lodestone/playguide/contentsguide/goldsaucer/lovm/|title=Lord of Verminion {{!}} FINAL FANTASY XIV, The Lodestone|last=Inc.|first=SQUARE ENIX|website=FINAL FANTASY XIV, The Lodestone|language=en-US|access-date=2016-07-02}} On January 26, 2017, Square Enix announced the development of ''Lord of Vermilion IV''.{{cite web|title=Square Enix Teases 'Exciting Announcement'|url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/square-enix-teases-exciting-announcement-update-re/1100-6447254/|website=Gamespot|publisher=Gamespot|accessdate=26 January 2017}} Another arcade release for up to eight players, it will feature music by [[Taku Iwasaki]].{{cite web|title=Lord of Vermilion IV|url=http://www.lordofv.com/lov4/|website=Lord of Vermilion IV official site|accessdate=26 January 2017}} ==Gameplay== {{Expand section|date=March 2009}} The player controls up to 4 units on the field at one time including the player's avatar and up to 90 total cost of units at one time. When a unit dies it must be returned to the inactive area and after a set amount of time it can be used again. Active units can only be switched in and out while the players units are in the gate area. Players can damage enemy arcane crystals, the search eye, the crystal shield or gates by putting their units in the associated area as long as no enemies are present. Players can also damage the arcane crystals by destroying all of the opponents units that are on the field. ==Story== In ancient times, before the creation of the worlds, there lived a God. He opened his heart and brought forth a vermilion stone in order to create seven different worlds. Whosoever held the vermilion stone held the power to create worlds, and would reign over the seven worlds as a god, the "Lord of Vermilion". The seven worlds existed side by side in harmony for millennia, their inhabitants separated by boundaries and unable to interfere with one another... until the "Great Collapse". The lord of the human world, consumed by ambition, sought to use the forbidden magic of the vermilion stone, called the "Arcana", in order to become a god. However, he was unable to wield the power and the Arcana was shattered into seven pieces and scattered amongst the seven worlds, destroying their boundaries. The six worlds were drawn into the human world and they merged. With the six races of the six worlds thrust into the human world, chaos and war broke out. Ages later, the world, called the "Land of Acheron", is still in turmoil. The six "Lords" of the six races sow strife across the land, warring for each other's Arcana. The player takes the role of a legendary warrior who holds the seventh Arcana and seeks to obtain the Arcana and upset the balance of the world, gathering an army of "Familiars" who hold faith in the legend of the "Lord of Vermilion". ==Characters== [[File:Lord of Vermilion videogame - Taito Station.jpg|thumb|250px|right|A gamer plays Lord of Vermilion video game on arcade. (Shibuya – Tokyo, Taito Station)]] *'''Player Character''': The player character is one of the few humans to survive the Great Collapse, and can be customized by the player. A legendary warrior with mysterious origins, the player seeks to use the power of Arcana, "Miracle", to reshape the world and return harmony to the land, and as such gathers an army of faithful followers in order to wage war on the six "Lords" and become the "Lord of Vermilion". There are two characters which the player may select from: the male {{nihongo|Nido|ニド}}, or the female {{nihongo|Rishia|リシア}}. They each have similar backstories and roles within the story mode. *'''Dux''': A mysterious knight completely clad in heavy armor, which completely conceals their identity and gender, who first appears in the tutorial and holds extensive knowledge on Arcana and the world. Dux is later revealed to be a former friend of the player's deceased father who agreed to watch over the player several years earlier. ==Expansion sets== ===''Lord of Vermilion''=== *Version 1.1: {{nihongo|Rebellion of the Gods|神々への離反|Kamigami he no Rihan}} *Version 1.2: {{nihongo|A New Omen|新たなる胎動|Arata naru Taidou}} *Version 1.3: {{nihongo|Invitation to Purgatory|煉獄からの誘い|Rengoku kara no Sasoi }} *Version 1.4: {{nihongo|Return to Chaos|混沌への回帰|Konton he no Kaiki}} ===''Lord of Vermilion II''=== *Version 2.1: {{nihongo|That Which was Summoned from the Void|深淵ヨリ招かれしモノ|Shin'en yori
